name: Travelling
description: When the ball handler takes too many steps without dribbling the ball. This signalis made by a rolling/snipping motion withboth arms.

name: 5 second violation
description: If the inbounder takes more than five seconds, the referee will stick out five fingers.

name: Double / Illegal dribble
description: When the ball handler picks up his dribble but then tries to dribble again afterward.

name: 10 Second Violation
description: After a team inbounds the ball, they are given ten seconds to get the past half court.

name: CARRYING / PALMING
description: When the ball handler either palms the ball or tries to scoop underneath it instead of dribbling correctly.

name: OVER AND BACK
description: Once the offensive team crosses the midcourt line, they are not allowed to go back across it. This will result in a loss of possession for the offensive team.

name: THREE SECOND VIOLATION
description: If the offensive player stays in the paint for a full three seconds, the play is blown dead and the offense must forfeit possession of the ball.

name: HAND CHECK
description: When a defender limits an offensive player with his hand. The signal is an open hand in the air while the other hand grabs the wrist.

name: CHARGING
description: When the ball handler runs over a defender who has set his feet and has established position, the referee will call a charging foul.

name: HOLDING
description: A defender cannot hold an offensive player. If he does, a holding call will be made.

name: INTENTIONAL FOUL
description: If an official deems that a defensive player fouls an offensive on purpose..

name: BLOCKING
description: When a defensive player stands in the way of the ball handler's path to the basket without setting his feet.

name: PUSHING
description: Usually called when a loose ball foul occurs. To gain possession one player may push another player out of the way.

name: TECHNICAL FOUL
description: Usually issued for unsportsman like conduct.

name: JUMP BALL
description: When opposing players have their handson the ball at the same time, a jump ball is called.

name: NO SCORE
description: When the shooter makes a basket but is fouled, the referee must determine if the foul occurred during the act of shooting. If the shooter wasn’t in the act of shooting        the basket doesn’t count

name: 30S TIMEOUT
description: When a team calls a 30-second timeout, the referee lets the scorer’s table to know by both of his hands to his shoulder.

name: 3 POINT ATTEMPT
description: To let the scorer's table know that a player has attempted a three-point shot.

name: 3 POINT SCORE
description: When a player hits a three-pointer, thereferee will raise both hands to signal that it was a successful three-point shot.
